title: One of the big three, keeping consumer costs elevated.
text:
Rogers, Bell, Telus; a closed triopoly, not interested in a free market, but only keeping Canadians hostage to their profit goals. 
Their prices (and profits) are kept high by keeping competition out. There is no proactive action taken to work towards securing better deals for clients… and there’s two other paths to take, which are different sides of the same triangle of corporate greed. They lobby really, really hard, under the guise of protecting Canadian interests, when their concern is only self serving.
Open up the communication market and see how well these three succeed in the face of fair competition.
author: P:ssed off
claude_summary: The review criticizes the lack of competition in the Canadian telecommunications market, where Rogers, Bell, and Telus maintain high prices and profits by keeping competition out, and calls for the market to be opened up to fair competition.

Nothing you need is accessible in the app. You have to go to their website. Funnily you guys suggest reinstall. I have a Huawei P20 Lite, which comes preloaded with MyRogers app. There is no provision to uninstall it. I have already uninstalled all thr updates and reinstalled. I will wait until the next app update to see if it replays the Whats New again.
author: A Google user
developer_response: Hi Sudhir, if you have tried the recommended steps and still no luck, please feel free to post a new message here: https://roge.rs/2F4tbNN to receive guidance for your issue! Thanks so much! ^yc  :) ^yc
claude_summary: The reviewer is extremely dissatisfied with the Rogers app, citing issues like the 'What's New' replay, lack of accessibility, and inability to uninstall the preloaded MyRogers app.
technical_issues: Repeated 'What's New' replay, Lack of accessibility to needed features, Inability to uninstall preloaded MyRogers app

text: Keeps crashing. Won't even load to the login screen. Has worked in the past but been down for a month at least. Very annoying and useless. Update: if I am connected to the WiFi in my home the app crashes everytime as stated above. If I use the LTE Rogers network, the app opens up and works appropriately. Don't understand why this would be but the "work around" fixes the problem.
author: A Google user
developer_response: Harry, that has to be frustrating, to say the very least! Can you kindly try uninstalling/reinstalling the app or disabling/re-enabling the app to see if this resolve the login issue? Update: Thanks for that info! Please reach out to us at https://communityforums.rogers.com so we can escalate a ticket to investigate this for you. ^tb
claude_summary: The user is experiencing frequent crashes with the Rogers app, which only occurs when connected to their home WiFi network. However, the app works properly when using the Rogers LTE network.
technical_issues: Crashes, Won't load to login screen
